dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 267 IH: Ceasing Age-Based Trucking Restrictions Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Mast (for himself, Mr. Perry, Mrs. Hinson, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Owens, Mr. McClintock, Mr. Guest, Mr. Feenstra, Mrs. Lesko, Mr. Steube, Mr. Gimenez, Ms. Tenney, Ms. Hageman, Mr. Valadao, Mr. Moore of Alabama, Mr. Johnson of Ohio, Mr. Womack, Mrs. Boebert, and Mr. Finstad) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to provide that the transportation of goods from a port of entry and another place within the same State as such port does not constitute interstate transportation, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ceasing Age-Based Trucking Restrictions Act.

section.header: Treatment of transportation of goods from a port

subsection.text: Chapter 313 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Treatment of transportation of goods from a port
section.text: The transportation of goods from a port of entry and another place within the same State as part of trade, traffic, or transportation originating outside such State or the United States by commercial motor vehicle shall not be considered interstate transportation for purposes of requirements relating to commercial driverâ€™s licenses under this chapter.

subsection.text: The analysis for chapter 313 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 31318. Treatment of transportation of goods from a port.
